ceterms:description:
This course introduces students to information technology as a discipline and the various roles and functions of the IT
department as business support. Students are presented with various IT disciplines including systems and services, network and security, scripting and programming, data management, and business of IT, with a survey of  technologies in every area and how they relate to each other and to the business.
-roles received
ceterms:name: TESTING_TESTING_Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT

ceterms:ownedBy.ceterms:description: Lipscomb was founded in Nashville, Tenn., in 1891 by two individuals–David Lipscomb and James A. Harding–who believed that a truly educated individual of their time could not be so without attention given to spiritual growth as well as academics. So in addition to its role as the most important guidebook in a Christian’s life, the Bible was also given an academic position along with, we suppose, the works of Aristotle, Ovid and other hallmarks of a classical education.
ceterms:ownedBy.ceterms:name: TESTING_Lipscomb University

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate evaluates ethical concerns involved in the use of technology.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate recognizes and describes functions of basic computer hardware components.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate describes IT as a discipline and discusses the history and future of computing as well as the currently used infrastructure.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate explains the structure and function of databases.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate describes information technology systems and their role in converting data to organizational knowledge.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate identifies the role of different types of software in a computing environment and explains the fundamentals of software development.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate describes the structure, function, and security associated with networks.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate identifies common software architectures, development techniques, and the relationship between software and its environment.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate explains the role of technology in today’s business environment and describes basic concepts of project management.

ceterms:teaches.ceterms:frameworkName: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology - Introduction to IT
ceterms:teaches.ceterms:targetNodeName: The graduate recommends appropriate strategies for classifying, installing, configuring, optimizing, upgrading, and troubleshooting printers.
